method.name: Fuzzy-Rough Nearest Neighbor algorithm

reference.ref: M. Sarkar, Fuzzy-rough nearest neighbor algorithms in classification, Fuzzy Sets and Systems, vol. 158, pp. 2134-2152, 2012.

generalDescription.howWork: FRNN associates fuzzy uncertainties to the existing overlapping between classes and rough uncertainties to the lack of a proper number of features to describe the data. Based on these concepts, an iterative method is proposed which is used to compute the similarity between the new instance and all the instances in the training set.

method.example:
Problem type: Classification Method: FRNN-C Dataset: appendicitis Test Show results: Vis-Clas-Check Parameters: Default settings
After the execution of RunKeel.jar we can see into the Vis-Clas-Check results' file the classification results for the test set:
TEST RESULTS ============ Classifier= appendicitis Fold 0 : CORRECT=0.8181818181818181 N/C=0.0 Fold 1 : CORRECT=0.9090909090909091 N/C=0.0 Fold 2 : CORRECT=0.8181818181818181 N/C=0.0 Fold 3 : CORRECT=0.9090909090909091 N/C=0.0 Fold 4 : CORRECT=1.0 N/C=0.0 Fold 5 : CORRECT=0.7272727272727273 N/C=0.0 Fold 6 : CORRECT=0.8 N/C=0.0 Fold 7 : CORRECT=0.9 N/C=0.0 Fold 8 : CORRECT=0.8 N/C=0.0 Fold 9 : CORRECT=1.0 N/C=0.0 Global Classification Error + N/C: 0.1318181818181818 stddev Global Classification Error + N/C: 0.08559466268986482 Correctly classified: 0.8681818181818182 Global N/C: 0.0
